content: Am I correct we don't have any version of the duality between MeasureTheory.Lp spaces for Hölder conjugate exponents?

We have the fact that if f is in L^p and g is in L^q for conjugate exponents, then their product is integrable, in docs#Memℒp.mul. So L^p embeds in the dual of L^q. Apart from the p=2 case (where it follows from general Hilbert space stuff), we don't have the complete identification, though.
Yeah, I guess what I really meant to ask was if we have surjectivity. Thanks for confirming.
